result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott M Hendrychowski was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the Wisconsin State Prison System.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Upon reissuance of driver's license. Court orders defendant to pay the cost of installation/maintenance of IID.
25% of prison funds, collected by Department of Corrections, to go toward all court ordered monetary obligations, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the State of Wisconsin department of corrections.  Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs. No possession,consumption,selling,distributing of illegal drugs,alcohol: random urine screens; if deemed appropriate.

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $1,800.00, provide DNA sample and pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge and all court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Defendant to pay all applicable fees of supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $0.00.

A payment plan for all monetary obligations is to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid monetary balances at the end of said period will convert to a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: First 2 months STRAIGHT TIME.  Last 4 months with HUBER FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH, TREATMENT, DAY REPORTING CENTER (IF ACCEPTED), SCRAM PROGRAM, AND ELECTRONIC SURVELLIANCE.  Court advised defendant on Extended Confinement or "bad time".

records.addlTxt: Also referenced ATN #41003153519231, arrest date 5-23-13, MCSD.
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.

Defendant Scott M Hendrychowski in court with attorney Patrick D Wait.  Defendant Scott M Hendrychowski in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 
.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  Credit given for 142 days time served if revoked.  25% of prison funds, collected by Department of Corrections, to go toward all court ordered monetary obligations, if revoked.
.-
COURT STAYS sentence and places defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.
-
Court ORDERS Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS CONDITION TIME at the House of Corrections.  First 2 MONTHS STRAIGHT TIME.  LAST 4 MONTHS WITH HUBER FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH, TREATMENT, DAY REPORTING CENTER (IF ACCEPTED), SCRAM PROGRAM, AND ELECTRONIC SURVELLIANCE.  
-
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the State of Wisconsin department of corrections;
-absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs;
-no possession,consumption,selling,distributing of illegal drugs,alcohol:
-random urine screens; if deemed appropriate;
-pay all applicable fees of supervision, failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-provide DNA sample;
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge, failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay restitution in the amount of $0.00 to **; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
-
-  Court ORDERS Defendant to pay a Fine in the amount of $1,800.00.
-  Court ORDERS Defendant's Driver's License SUSPENDED for a period of 24 MONTHS.
-  Court ORDERS Ignition Interlock Device be installed on Defendant's Vehicle(s) for a period of 1 YEAR upon reissuance of drivers license.
-  Court ORDERS defendant to pay the cost of installation/maintenance of IID.
-  Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment And Driver Safety Plan, SIGNED AND FILED.
- 
-  A payment plan for all monetary obligations is to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid monetary balances at the end of said period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  No Cash Bail was posted in this matter.
-  Firearm/Voting Rights/Civil Judgment Warnings given.
-
Court advised defendant on Extended Confinement or "bad time".
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Appeal rights given. Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Acknowledgment of ineligibility  Copies given to defendant.

Defendant Scott M Hendrychowski in court with attorney Patrick D Wait.  Defendant Scott M Hendrychowski in custody.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was NOT ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 22.

AS TO COUNT 2:  DISMISSED BY STATE PROSECUTOR UPON PLEA NEGOTIATIONS.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-30-2014 at 08:30 am.
At the request of Attorney Patrick Waite, Pretrial Conference is removed from Court's Calendar on 04-18-2014 at 08:30am, and Plea Hearing is scheduled in its place.

Attorney Patrick D. Wait in court, defendant Scott M Hendrychowski not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling Conference was held in Branch 22, not in Preliminary Court.
Pretrial Conference scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-18-2014 at 08:30 am.
FILE UNAVAILABLE AT THE TIME OF THIS ENTRY.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.

Defendant Scott M Hendrychowski in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Scott M Hendrychowski in custody.  Francesco G Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
